intro: Sisymbrium officinale var. leiocarpum, commonly known as smoothpod wild radish, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring alternate, pinnately lobed leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruit is a short, smooth pod containing several small, round seeds. This variant is distinguished by its smooth, glabrous pods, which set it apart from other varieties of Sisymbrium.
